title: Kled Interactions

embed.description: The Special/Hidden/Secret Interactions for the new Champion Kled Shows all the specific champion kills, taunts etc Kled has. Stay upto date with information by following me on twitter: https://twitter.com/SkinSpotlights This video is 100% accurate at the time of creation, PBE is constantly changing so things might change in a couple patches.

body:
Oddly, he doesn't have any item interactions other than ward placement apparently. 

However, most of his champion lines are from kills instead of taunting near them, which means a more realistic chance of them appearing in game.

replies.body:
I can't tell if 3:34 is a reference to Looney Tunes's Bugs Bunny or not
"Of course you realise, dis means woyr"

It is.   
There's about 35 lines that ref pop culture  in his script.    I don't think anyone's spotted them all yet.

YEAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH
Looney Tunes is my favourite show and that makes me happy
Sooo... what inspired the Chocobo skin?
yugioh
Considering his taunts towards Sion, I'm confused on how he feels about him.

Personal thoughts: Kled heard about or knew Sion when he was alive, and admired the man's power and ideology; a proper Noxian in Kled's eyes. At some point during the various times high command sent the initially resurrected Sion to fight Demacia, Kled butchered him after Sion proved uncontrollable, leaving his pieces for the army to clean up.

Dunno really. It's interesting to hear that of all the Noxian champions Kled has interactions with its Sion and Riven who he speaks more positively about, or at least not directly being insulting.

His interaction with Riven fascinates me the most as he alludes to her being closest to the Noxian ideal. Whereas with other Noxians he outright insults them. 

Even Darius, a man who wishes to unite Noxus, doesn't earn any positive recognition. 

Must say something about how different modern Noxus really is. But is that a good or bad thing?
I guess it depends on perspective. Who's the true Noxian, the one who embodies its system or the one who'd leave it behind so they can try and rebuild it later?

Perhaps Kled is seeing Darius as a fool going down with the ship while there are perfectly good lifeboats available. 

Darius cares too much about the actual country, while Kled and Riven care about the ideals.

Aye, being Noxian is about having the right perspective. Noxus is a country founded by people who had that mindset, but is Noxus a place like that today?

I guess it's kinda fitting that a yordle's the one telling Noxians about what it truly means to be Noxian, and how the more unlikely of people like a traitor to the empire are more true to that ideal than even the nations most decorated generals.

I'm under the impression that the choice (and the action) to resurrect Sion was what started Noxus on a path away from their ideals. 

Man, now I want to learn about Predeath Sion all the more!!!
Black Rose man. Never trust sorcerers who aren't upfront with you about things.
In the words of Sion, "Hmph, spells."

Or in Boram Darkwill's words
"Sion, Beware Ravens"
Raven's don't forget the face of someone who's wronged them. It's best to not get near.
I think that's crows.
They're basically the same thing, being birds in the corvus genus. The terms are basically interchangable, with ravens often just being slightly bigger.
thats racist lol
Nah ravens are pretty social too last I checked. Crows in general are considered to be among the most intelligent animals on the planet, right up their with elephants and apes.

Hmm I wouldn't even know if Noxus Ideal wasn't twisted to begin with. I mean we know Demacia has origin from the protectioners, so Noxus I assume has roots in the Magelords. We know how much Aatrox mess with that battle and I wouldn't expect that really fucked up their idealogy when the reform into Noxus after probably butchering the locals. I mean the Magelord doesn't sound to be the violent noxian ideal Noxus currently has. So who knows maybe the fools are those are those who believe in the ideals left by insane and bitter Magelords after seeing they massacare cause due to Aatrox influence.
Do we actually know that they both originated from the magelords and protectorates?

Nope. The Magelords and Protectorate have only ever been referenced in Aatrox's lore and no where else. Some have speculated that the sides of Summoner's Rift are those two factions, but given Aurelion Sol's short story Twin Dawns I'd say that's not the case either.
How so? It mention in Twin dawn that Aurellion sol states that one side would claim it as a side symbol of their nation. Looking at Demacias flag, that decent enough of a connection.

> _The desert below fades into the night trailing behind me as I streak onward across lonely steppes, then over rolling brown hills gently flecked with greenery. The pastoral scenery belies a field spattered with blood and littered with the dead and dying. Survivors hack away at each other with rough-hewn axes and scream battle cries. One side is losing quite badly. Stag skulls rest atop pikes stuck into the soil, next to writhing warriors. The few still on their feet are encircled by soldiers riding great shaggy beasts._

> _Those defeated, surrounded few see me and valiance seems to surge through their veins. The wounded rise and grasp their axes and bows in a final stand that throws their foes off guard. I don't linger to see the rest of the little clash play out because I've seen this scenario unfold a thousand times: The survivors will scratch my comet likeness onto their cave walls. In a thousand years, their descendants will fly my image on banners and undoubtedly ride into a tediously similar battle. For all their efforts to capture and record history, one ponders why they do not learn from their mistakes. That is a lesson even I have had to suffer._

In no way does that piece of lore indicate that either side of that conflict are the Magelords or the Protectorate, or that the stag side were directly connected to Demacia. Nations crumble and are built up again with only culture keeping things consistent, so while Demacia's insignia could've been spawned from the visage of Aurelion Sol in flight, it's not guaranteed that they are descended from the blue side faction of Summoner's Rift, as any culture could've also seen Aurelion Sol flying overhead at some point and done the same thing -

 _I've seen this scenario unfold a thousand times: The survivors will scratch my comet likeness onto their cave walls. In a thousand years, their descendants will fly my image on banners_

As Aurelion's saying, it's happened thousands of times over the course of the universe's history. It's probably happened on Runeterra before.

And back to the Magelords and Protectorate thing, again, no mention anywhere of anything indicating that it is the case. Aatrox's lore implies that those two factions were the oldest human civilisations known to history, where as we know that the forces fighting on Summoner's Rift when Aurelion was flying over were doing so at a relatively similar time to when the Sun Disc was being built in Shurima. Aatrox also appeared in Shurima enough to be depicted on pottery, so it's always been implied that the Magelords and Protectorate predate every other known human societies, and given the fact that the blue and red sides of the rift existed when the Shuriman empire was a thing, they aren't old enough to be the Magelords or Protectorate.

Strange how he has more interactions for champs he kills than when he taunts, but I guess that fits his personality. 
Though that part of his taunt to {{champion:122}} about him looking a bit Ionian was interesting. Hint to new lore or just Kled being an ass to Darius? Could just be the second one, but you never know.
It said in the top left 'TAUNT - ENEMY NOXIAN CHAMPION' so it's not just Darius. It's any Noxian champ. Possibly even himself
I'm surprised he doesn't have any {{champion:203}} taunts considering 50% of his dialog talks about trespassing, and a key part of Kindred is literally invading the enemy jungle.
As well as being the living embodiment of death, yet couldn't take kled down.
I feel like the most interesting interactions he has are with Aatrox. Seems yordles have some insight on just who and what the darkin are.

Specifically Kled. I made a post about it. http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/BZwnm9L8-kled-lore-could-kled-have-gotten-some-powers-from-aatrox . Kled is known to be old and Noxus is known to have stories of Aatrox.

Doesn't mean the two are intrinsically linked; Aatrox could've appeared in Noxian history at any point, where as we know Kled's been around for potentially as long as the empire's been a thing. I'm more inclined to believe it's because whatever force is behind darkin and demons, yordles can discern it. Tahm's got it out for almost every yordle out there, and Kled clearly knows something about demons.

I feel like we need more explanation on yordles and demons in general, but one proposition I'll make is that Kled's resentment of Noxians might stem from Aatrox twisting the vision of Noxus that Kled originally liked. That's a huge leap in theorising there though so I dunno. Kled's incredibly demeaning to Aatrox _specifically_ so I doubt Kled was empowered by Aatrox, though a meeting between them isn't out of the question.

I do kinda like that these fuzzy yordles are seemingly the natural enemies of demons and darkin. It's both intriguing and very interesting.
Or he's mad. Could be both actually. Though with the demon reference I wonder if that makes the Darkin a race of demons?
Could potentially be that the darkin were a kind of demon that elevated themselves to a higher form of culture and society, or perhaps they're just super demons.

Super demons you say?

http://www.gannett-cdn.com/-mm-/dcb80218152231bc3b7cb50314b135118ec8e62d/c=0-144-6000-4655&r=x408&c=540x405/local/-/media/2016/01/26/USATODAY/USATODAY/635894195016798086-superdevil-familyguy.jpg
For a Noxian folk hero he sure has a lot of taunts about killing Noxians.  Also now we know he just calls all yordles cuz so he's probably not related to any specific one, still might be though.

> Embodying the furious bravado of his nation, he is an icon beloved by the empire's soldiers, distrusted by its officers, and loathed by the nobility.

Most of his dislike is toward the Noxian leadership or high ranked officials. I noticed the only one he came close to complimenting was riven, who was just a soldier.

> [{quoted}](name=kitcat300,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=BrQappgo,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2016-07-29T18:10:07.735+0000)
>
> Most of his dislike is toward the Noxian leadership or high ranked officials. I noticed the only one he came close to complimenting was riven, who was just a soldier.

Oh I get that, I'm more just surprised he doesn't have a line or two about "this is my land" to Ionians since that was what the Ionian/Noxian war was about. Or anything about why Demacians are stupid.
he does mention ionia in one of his lines to Skaarl though.

>"Yeah, yeah, invade Ionia you said, it'll be fine you said!"
>"Fine, you said!"

Yeah, that's the line. It sounds like the invasion didn't go as Kled how expected or what he was told to expect. Now whether he's talking about his own experiences during the invasion or how the invasion went for Noxus as a whole is a question for the future. Maybe the Ionian invasion turned out to be a lot more trouble than it was worth.

Though, I'm honestly not even sure if Kled is serious or that's just the insanity plus the mushroom juice speaking. Actually, that's my feeling for half of his VO. The other half is about him killing things or yelling at Skaarl, so I know he's legit with what he is saying there......well mostly legit.

Based on his lines to Riven, I would think that means he is more in line with Riven's way of thinking; that this "invasion" was just cruel and evil rather than showing the real noxian ideals (it's very likely that he would know what singed has done.)

Kled sheds some interesting light on Noxus, let's hope they give us more lore from his perspective to really see what's going on in Noxus (even if he is crazy, he's still sane it seems. He could probably tell reasonably accurate stories from his campaigns.)
Oh, and since WAAARGHbobo has more or less challenged us to find all 35 lines of references, this is from Asterix and Obelix ;)
It is funny how the MOST IMPORTANT STUFF EVAR!  is so often ignored and unappreciated.    (sob)
Well, I won't stand this injustice. :p
what which line??? Damn those were my favourite fkn comics ever. sry batman

The one quoted in the post I replied to. You should read the thread in discussion mode if it's not the case already ;)

> "Yeah, yeah, invade Ionia you said, it'll be fine you said!"

Don't know what's the exact version in English, but this is very reminiscent of the "Engagez vous, Rengagez-vous qu'ils disaient!" et of the general complaints that the footmen in the roman army regularly utter after being beaten down by the Gaulois.

> [{quoted}](name=WAAARGHbobo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=BrQappgo,comment-id=0002000000010000,timestamp=2016-07-30T03:42:24.426+0000)
>
> he does mention ionia in one of his lines to Skaarl though.

Yeah I caught that. Which is just more why I'm surprised he doesn't have any interaction about what I can only guess where the atrocities he committed on Ionian soil to Ionian heroes. Since we know for certain he was there. 

Though maybe avoiding that was your intention. Since, screaming about murder is funny up until you actually give an example of him eviscerating commoners.
The likelihood is that Noxus, to Kled, is as more about the ideology than the nationality. He seemingly respects Riven's ideology to some degree, or he might do if he ever met her.

This only makes me more disappointed that we aren't getting a Noxian lore update. 

I mean...look I get that there are several channels to deal with, but the last two champions gave us a lore update for their faction along with them. I guess I was expecting the same if the next new Champion was connected to a faction (unlike say Ryze, who is independent). 

All this talk of Noxian lore possibilities is making me wish it so!

I feel like Taliyah and Aurelion Sol set a precedent for some, but it was more fortunate timing rather than planned from the start - their concepts fell in to those nations naturally over the course of their development rather than them being planned for those nations right from day 1, I mean that's 100% true for Aurelion considering he was once Ao Shin. While I too would love a big Noxus lore update a la Targon and Shurima, that shit takes time. I'm at the very least hopeful for at least one more large scale lore related thingy-ma-bob before the year's over.
